description: Copied A.H. 942 [A.D. 1536]. Fols. 69; 23.5 x 16.8 cm.; written surface 16.3-17 x 10.7 cm.; 11 lines to page; on glazed Arabic paper; in naskhi; with catchwords; headings in red. A collection of original poems on alchemy arranged according to the alphabetical order of their rhymes. The work is otherwise known as Shudhūr al-dhahab fī al-iksīr. Beg.: بسم الله ... قال الشىخ الامام العالم العلامة امام Colophon: رفع الله حجاب الغفلة عن قلوبنا وبلغنا بفضله ما فىه لنا الخىر من مطلوبنا بمنه وکرمه امىن رب العالمىن Marginal and interlinear notes and glosses; rules marginal lines in red. On title page occurs a statement that this work contains 43 poems and 1487 verses and that it was copied A.H. 942 [A.D. 1536]. MS in good condition but stained with dampness; Arabic binding with flap. Acquired from Brill, Leyden, A.D. 1900. ḥājjī Khalīfah, Kashf al-ẓunūn (1835-58), IV, p. 17; Fihrist al-kutub al-ʻArabīyah al-maḥfūẓah bi-al-Kutubkhānah al-Khudaywīyah, V, p. 383; Catalogus codicum manuscriptorum orientalium (1846), 601¹; Ahlwardt, Verzeichnis der arabischen Handschriften, 4180.
author: Anṣāri,̄ ʻAlī ibn Mūsá, 1121 or 2-1196 or 7.
